maml:description.maml:para: Gets an account.

The Get-AzCognitiveServicesAccount cmdlet gets the provisioned Cognitive Services accounts in the resource group specified by the ResourceGroupName parameter. If you do not specify the ResourceGroupName parameter, this cmdlet gets all Cognitive Services accounts for the current subscription.

maml:Description.maml:para: Specifies the name of the resource group the Cognitive Services account is assigned to.
Specifies the name of the Cognitive Services account to get.
The credentials, account, tenant, and subscription used for communication with azure
Specifies the name of the resource group the Cognitive Services account is assigned to.
The credentials, account, tenant, and subscription used for communication with azure
The credentials, account, tenant, and subscription used for communication with azure
Specifies the name of the Cognitive Services account to get.
Specifies the name of the resource group the Cognitive Services account is assigned to.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code:
PS C:\> New-AzCognitiveServicesAccount -ResourceGroupName cognitive-services-resource-group -name myluis -Type LUIS -SkuName S0 -Locati on 'WestUS'
ResourceGroupName : cognitive-services-resource-group AccountName : myluis Id : /subscriptions/xxxxxxxx-xxxx-xxxx-xxxx-xxxxxxxxxxxx/resourceGroups/cognitive-services-resource-group/providers/Microsoft.Cog nitiveServices/accounts/myluis Endpoint : https://westus.api.cognitive.microsoft.com/luis/v2.0 Location : WESTUS Sku : Microsoft.Azure.Management.CognitiveServices.Models.Sku AccountType : LUIS ResourceType : Microsoft.CognitiveServices/accounts Etag : "xxxxxxxx-xxxx-xxxx-xxxx-xxxxxxxxxxxx" ProvisioningState : Succeeded Tags :

maml:description.maml:para: Gets the API keys for an account.

The Get-AzCognitiveServicesAccountKey cmdlet gets the API keys for a provisioned Cognitive Services account. A Cognitive Services account has two API keys: Key1 and Key2. The keys enable interaction with the Cognitive Services account endpoint. Use New-AzCognitiveServicesAccountKey to regenerate a key.

maml:Description.maml:para: Specifies the name of the resource group the account is assigned to.
Specifies the name of the account. This cmdlet gets the keys for this account.
The credentials, account, tenant, and subscription used for communication with azure
The credentials, account, tenant, and subscription used for communication with azure
Specifies the name of the account. This cmdlet gets the keys for this account.
Specifies the name of the resource group the account is assigned to.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code:
PS C:\> Get-AzCognitiveServicesAccountKey -ResourceGroupName cognitive-services-resource-group -name myluis
Key1 Key2 ---- ---- xxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxx xxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxx

maml:description.maml:para: Get the NetworkRule property of a Cognitive Services account
The Get-AzCognitiveServicesAccountNetworkRuleSet cmdlet gets the NetworkRule property of a Cognitive Services account

maml:Description.maml:para: Resource Group Name.
Cognitive Services Account Name.

Resource Group Name.

command:example.maml:title: Example 1: Get NetworkRule property of a specified Cognitive Services account

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command gets NetworkRule property of a specified Cognitive Services account

maml:description.maml:para: Gets the available SKUs for an account.

The Get-AzCognitiveServicesAccountSku cmdlet gets the available SKUs for a Cognitive Services account. The SKU is the tier plan for an account. It defines the price, call limit, and rate for the account. The F0 SKU is a free tier. Paid tiers include S0, S1, S2, and so on.

maml:Description.maml:para: The credentials, account, tenant, and subscription used for communication with azure
Cognitive Services Account Location.
Cognitive Services Account Type.
The credentials, account, tenant, and subscription used for communication with azure
Cognitive Services Account Location.
Cognitive Services Account Type.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code:
PS C:\> (Get-AzCognitiveServicesAccountSku -Type 'TextAnalytics' -Location "westus").Value | Select-Object -E xpandProperty Sku;
Name Tier ---- ---- F0 Free S0 Standard

maml:description.maml:para: Gets the available Cognitive Services Account Types.
The Get-AzCognitiveServicesAccountType cmdlet gets the available Cognitive Services Account Types under this subscription.

maml:Description.maml:para: The credentials, account, tenant, and subscription used for communication with Azure.
Cognitive Services Account Location.
The credentials, account, tenant, and subscription used for communication with Azure.
Cognitive Services Account Type Name.
The credentials, account, tenant, and subscription used for communication with Azure.
Cognitive Services Account Location.
Cognitive Services Account Type Name.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Get the list of available Types.
Get the list of available Types in westus.
Check if `Face` is a valid Type name, the name will be returned if it is a valid name.

maml:description.maml:para: Get current usages for a Cognitive Services account.
The Get-AzCognitiveServicesAccountUsage cmdlet gets current usages for a Cognitive Services account.

maml:Description.maml:para: Cognitive Services Account Object.
The credentials, account, tenant, and subscription used for communication with Azure.
Resource Group Name.
Cognitive Services Account Name.
The credentials, account, tenant, and subscription used for communication with Azure.
Cognitive Services Account Resource ID.
The credentials, account, tenant, and subscription used for communication with Azure.
The credentials, account, tenant, and subscription used for communication with Azure.
Cognitive Services Account Object.
Cognitive Services Account Name.
Resource Group Name.
Cognitive Services Account Resource ID.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code:
PS C:\> Get-AzCognitiveServicesAccountUsage -ResourceGroupName TestUsages -Name TestCVUsages_Prediction
CurrentValue : 0 Name : CustomVision.Prediction.Transactions Limit : 10000 Status : Included Unit : Count QuotaPeriod : 30.00:00:00 NextResetTime : 0001-01-01T00:00:00Z

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 2 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code:
PS C:\GitHub> $acc = Get-AzCognitiveServicesAccount -ResourceGroupName TestUsages -Name TestCVUsages_Prediction
PS C:\GitHub> Get-AzCognitiveServicesAccountUsage -InputObject $acc
CurrentValue : 0 Name : CustomVision.Prediction.Transactions Limit : 10000 Status : Included Unit : Count QuotaPeriod : 30.00:00:00 NextResetTime : 0001-01-01T00:00:00Z

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 3 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code:
PS C:\GitHub> $acc = Get-AzCognitiveServicesAccount -ResourceGroupName TestUsages -Name TestCVUsages_Prediction
PS C:\GitHub> Get-AzCognitiveServicesAccountUsage -ResourceId $acc.Id
CurrentValue : 0 Name : CustomVision.Prediction.Transactions Limit : 10000 Status : Included Unit : Count QuotaPeriod : 30.00:00:00 NextResetTime : 0001-01-01T00:00:00Z

maml:description.maml:para: Creates a Cognitive Services account.
The New-AzCognitiveServicesAccount cmdlet creates a Cognitive Services account with the specified type and SKU.

maml:Description.maml:para: Specifies the name of the resource group to which to assign the account. The resource group must already exist.
Specifies the name for the account.
Specifies the type of account to create. Use `Get-AzCognitiveServicesAccountType` cmdlet to get current acceptable values.
Specifies the SKU for the account. The acceptable values for this parameter are: - F0 (free tier)
For more information, see Cognitive Service APIs (https://www.microsoft.com/cognitive-services/en-us/apis).
Specifies the location in which to create the account.
The ApiProperties of Cognitive Services Account. Required by specific account types.
Generate and assign a new Cognitive Services Account Identity for this storage account for use with key management services like Azure KeyVault.
Whether to set Cognitive Services Account Encryption KeySource to Microsoft.CognitiveServices or not.
Cognitive Services Account Subdomain Name.
The credentials, account, tenant, and subscription used for communication with azure
Forces the command to run without asking for user confirmation.

NetworkRuleSet is used to define a set of configuration rules for firewalls and virtual networks, as well as to set values for network properties such as how to handle requests that don't match any of the defined rules
The network access type for Cognitive Services Account.
List of User Owned Storage Accounts.
Specifies a tag as a name/value pair.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.

Whether to set Cognitive Services Account encryption keySource to Microsoft.KeyVault or not. If you specify KeyName, KeyVersion and KeyVaultUri, Cognitive Services Account Encryption KeySource will also be set to Microsoft.KeyVault weather this parameter is set or not.

Cognitive Services Account encryption keySource KeyVault KeyVersion

maml:description.maml:para: Generate a new instance of Cognitive Services Account ApiProperties

Generate a new instance of Cognitive Services Account ApiProperties. ApiProperties can be used when creating a new account or updating an existing account. ApiProperties is required by certain account types.

maml:Description.maml:para: The credentials, account, tenant, and subscription used for communication with Azure.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
The credentials, account, tenant, and subscription used for communication with Azure.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> $apiProperties = New-AzCognitiveServicesAccountApiProperty PS C:\> $apiProperties.QnaRuntimeEndpoint = "https://qnamaker.azurewebsites.net" PS C:\> New-AzCognitiveServicesAccount -ResourceGroupName cognitive-services-resource-group -name qnamaker -Type QnAMaker -SkuName S0 -Locatio WestUS -ApiProperty $apiProperties

dev:remarks.maml:para: Above example will create an QnAMaker account, with API property "QnaRuntimeEndpoint".
